alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 8:20PM MST until August 11 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 1030 PM MST. * At 818 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area earlier this evening. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fall earlier tonight. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Kanab Creek, Sowats Canyon, Colorado River, Snake Gulch and Jumpup Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
